block.p: LEAD: Following is the roll-call vote of 272 to 154 by which the House of Representatives today approved a civil rights bill to combat job discrimination. A yes vote was a vote to pass the bill. Voting yes were 240 Democrats and 32 Republicans. Voting no were 12 Democrats and 142 Republicans. X denotes those not voting.

LEAD: Following is the roll-call vote of 272 to 154 by which the House of Representatives today approved a civil rights bill to combat job discrimination. A yes vote was a vote to pass the bill. Voting yes were 240 Democrats and 32 Republicans. Voting no were 12 Democrats and 142 Republicans. X denotes those not voting.

Following is the roll-call vote of 272 to 154 by which the House of Representatives today approved a civil rights bill to combat job discrimination. A yes vote was a vote to pass the bill. Voting yes were 240 Democrats and 32 Republicans. Voting no were 12 Democrats and 142 Republicans. X denotes those not voting. There are two vacancies in the 435-member House.
